melanoma.name: Melanoma
melanoma.description: Most serious type of skin cancer, arising from melanocytes
characteristics: Diameter larger than a pencil eraser (>6mm)
Rapid growth or change over time
melanoma.epidemiology: Accounts for 1% of skin cancers but 99% of deaths
melanoma.5_year_survival: 95% if caught early, drops significantly with progression
melanoma.prevention: Daily SPF 30+ sunscreen, avoid peak sun hours, regular self-examination

basal_cell_carcinoma.name: Basal Cell Carcinoma (BCC)
basal_cell_carcinoma.description: Most common type of skin cancer, arises from basal cells in epidermis
recommendations: Treatment options: excision, Mohs surgery, cryotherapy, curettage
basal_cell_carcinoma.prevention: Sunscreen SPF 30+, protective clothing, regular skin checks

squamous_cell_carcinoma.name: Squamous Cell Carcinoma (SCC)
squamous_cell_carcinoma.description: Second most common skin cancer, arises from squamous cells
characteristics: May appear on ears, lips, or sun-exposed areas
squamous_cell_carcinoma.5_year_survival: 95% if caught early, varies with stage
recommendations: Treatment: surgical excision, Mohs surgery, or radiation
squamous_cell_carcinoma.prevention: SPF 30+ daily, protective clothing, avoid peak sun, stop smoking

benign_keratosis.name: Benign Keratosis (Seborrheic Keratosis)
benign_keratosis.epidemiology: Most common benign skin growth in older adults
recommendations: No treatment necessary unless for cosmetic reasons
Can be removed by dermatologist if desired
Confirm diagnosis to rule out malignancy
benign_keratosis.prevention: Regular self-examination, sun protection, dermatology check-ups

nevus.name: Nevus (Mole)
nevus.description: Common benign skin growth from melanocytes
recommendations: Annual dermatology check for high-risk individuals
nevus.prevention: Sun protection, regular skin checks, family monitoring if high-risk

actinic_keratosis.name: Actinic Keratosis (Solar Keratosis)
actinic_keratosis.description: Precancerous lesion caused by sun damage
characteristics: Usually on face, ears, hands, arms
actinic_keratosis.epidemiology: ~58 million cases in US, precursor to SCC
actinic_keratosis.prevention: Daily SPF 30+, protective clothing, avoid sun 10am-4pm, sunglasses

skin_self_examination: Use ABCDE rule: Asymmetry, Border irregularity, Color variation, Diameter >6mm, Evolving/changing
Use mirror or ask partner to check hard-to-see areas
Note any new growths or changes
Take photos to track changes over time
sun_protection: Reapply every 2 hours and after swimming
Wear protective clothing: hat, sunglasses, long sleeves
Avoid tanning beds and sun lamps
Check UV index and plan accordingly
medical_consultation: See dermatologist for any suspicious lesions
Discuss personal and family skin cancer history
general_recommendations.early_detection: Early detection significantly improves survival rates for all skin cancers. When in doubt, consult a dermatologist.
